Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2008 05:27AM cinlee wrote: Morning everyone, Well I slept good finally last night.  I take care of a woman with Alzhiemer's on Saturday's and I got through that good then got home last night and tried to eat something, yuk, took an extra Zanax and went to bed about 9 and slept til 7 this morning.  I did wake up with a wicked headache this morning though.  Maybe I'll feel better after a cup of coffee.  I hope my coffee still taste's good because I love my coffee and I don't want to lose that too.  Still have the redness on my face and neck and chest like a sunburn but so far that's it for side effects.  Oh yea a little constipation, coffee helped yesterday.  It's day 3 for me and so far not too bad other than everything tastes terrible.  Yesterday when my grand daughter came in the first thing she did was sit on my lap and check to see if it was my hair on my head or a wig.  She's so cute, she has a great sense of humor and loves to tease grandma and thinks it's funny that I'm going to be bald, but she also wants to take care of me when I get sick.  She's my driving force to fight this thing and not let it get me down.  Well the coffees done brewing so I'll be back later.  Hang in there everyone we'll get through this. Cindy
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 7, 2008 06:01AM cinlee wrote: Good morning girls, Day 4 and I'm doing pretty good.  Coffee still tastes good!!! Thank god for that, food isn't tasting so good, no appetite, drinking water, gatorade, (which I don't like) and slimfast shakes for the proteins, did enjoy my Ben & Jerry's Cherry Garcia very much yesterday.  Sleeping better and still have energy during the day, took grampa to church yesterday as usual, puttered around the yard a bit as the weather here in Upstate NY is finally getting better, in the 60's yesterday and sunny and fresh air was soooo nice.  Oh yea, I ordered 2 wigs from Paula Young and 2 scarves this weekend.  Not sure how I feel about that yet.  Hope they look ok.  Well guess I better finish getting ready for work.  Usually work 8:30 til 7 on Monday, hope I can get through the whole day but not going to feel bad if I can't.  Bonbon and Thai my thoughts are with you today.  Take care everyone, if it seems I'm leaving anyone out please forgive me I don't mean to, probably the most frustrating side effect so far for me is forgetfullness and inability to focus.  Love you all, we'll beat this thing together.  Keep positive. Cindy
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 15, 2008 01:11PM cinlee wrote: Hi Northern, My diagnosis is exactly the same as yours w/o the mastectomy though.  I had my 1st tx on 4/4 and had the usual sleeplessness because of steroids for a couple of days, then 5 days of constipation.  Thursday got sick and diarrhea.  I also have history of gastrointestinal problems and ulcer from years ago.  Now I'm having problems with those issues again.  Worked everyday but Friday, then Sunday got ear ache and sore throat a little.  Went to work Monday for half day sore throat got worse Monday night so I took today off.  Been gargling with salt water a lot seems to help.  Now I'm having black bowel movements so I talked to my PCP today, who's great by the way, gave me a huge hug rather than handshake like usual when I saw him Friday, he said the onco dr.will want to do a rectal exam...yuk..and some blood tests to see what the problem is with the black BM.  On a good note, I got my 2 wigs and scarves I ordered from Paula Young today in the mail although I'm on day 11 I think and I haven't had any signs of losing any hair yet and I love them.   I was sooooo worry about how they would look.  Color matches mine perfect, short wig is great just the way it is and shoulder length will have to be styled a little different by my hairdresser.  Longer one is exactly the same as my cut now but too full.  I can't tell you how relieved I am about the wigs.  Like you I'm anxious to get this over and done with so I'm hoping this sore throat and minor cold issue goes away soon.  My next tx isn't til 4/25 so I still have almost 2 weeks but I don't want to have to put any of them off and prolong the whole thing any longer than necessary.  Treatment day was really very uneventful and only took 3 hours.  I even went out to dinner afterwords and felt fine.  Next tx's will only take 2-2 1/2 hrs per chemo nurse.  I'll be thinking of you and will add you to my prayers along with everyone else.  Did some yard work with my gram today.  Was nice to get out in the fresh air and get some exercise despite sore throat but a little tired now.  Gonna take a nap w/o feeling guilty...Gram was really having a difficult time with the whole hair loss thing and hated it when I talked about buying wigs and shaving my head but she really liked them when I tried them on for her today so now she feels better too.  Take care everyone, better days are coming. Cindy
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 18, 2008 01:08PM cinlee wrote: OMG Otter it's like you're reading my mind.  I keep saying I'm going to do the whole shave my head as soon as I see any signs of hair loss but now that I had a few strays this morning I'm thinking not.  I want to keep my hair as long as possible.  I was going to get it cut short before just to make a gradual adjustment but I like my hair style which fairly new for me only about 5 months, just below chin length in front a little shorter in back and side part with long bangs.  Unfortunately I was blessed with my father's receeding hair line so this style doesn't allow that to show so much.  And then there's the whole vein thing.  When I went to emergency Tues. night I told the nurse to be gentle I need my veins to hold up for my next 3 chemo treatments.  The stories I'm hearing about the port scare me and I don't want more to care for or take meds for than I am now.  I feel for those of you who have to go through that.  When I went for my 10 day check-up with the onc. I set up my next appt. for tx#2 which is the day after yours and my first thought was, do we have to wait can't we just do it this Friday and get it done with?  Fortunately my counts were good and my sore throat and fever symptoms are much much better so it isn't going to effect next tx.  Going to stay with my daughter and grand daughter tonight for a girls night pajama party thing just the 3 of us.  I can't emphasize enough....thank god for kids and grandkids.  Keeping everyone in my prayers we'll get through this. Cindy
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 19, 2008 06:20PM cinlee wrote: Well it happened.  For the last 3 or 4 days I've been running my hand through my hair and nothings coming out, then wham all of a sudden last night I did it and a whole handful so I kept trying and it kept coming out, mostly from underneath so it just looks like I got a trim and had it thinned out, but man it was just weird how quickly it happened and how easily it came out and the amount that came out, then it stopped.  My granddaughter and I went down to the lake this morning to watch the sunrise for the first time this year it was absolutely gorgeous and I kept running my hands through my hair as we walked down the pier and hardly nothing was coming out, then this afternoon it started again.  I had already had plans to get it shaved once it started but now it's reality and I'm scared to death and very depressed.  My girlfriend is going to do it for me tomorrow.  I have 2 wigs and a few scarves but I'm sending one wig back because I don't like it and I really like the scarves better and would rather spend my money on a few more of those to accessorize with my workcloths.  People keep telling me I should wait but a part of me is afraid to touch my hair and the other part wants to tug on it to see if more is going to come out.  Physically I'm feeling much better but emotionally drained and tired tonight.  I was hoping to get a full week of work in next week before tx 2 on 4/25.  Hope everyone is doing well. Love and prayers to everyone, Cindy
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 21, 2008 01:31AM cinlee wrote: Hi girls, Well I did it, it's completely gone.  All of a sudden on friday night it started coming out in clumps and by this morning after I took a shower it was so thin and short I decided it was time.  It wasn't bad at all.  I kept telling everyone else who was more upset than me and kept trying to convince me not to shave it yet that the way I look at it is this is one more step in this whole process and once it's shaved it's one more step behind me.  I didn't shed 1 tear and the wig I picked out everyone loves.  I like the style but the feeling is weird.  My head was tingling all the way home and I'm afraid to move my head because I'm afraid the wigs going to move.  I couldn't wait to get home and get it off and put my soft nightcap on.  Once I got home and was in my room by myself and really took a good look in the mirror it hit me that this is the way I'm going to look for months.  Very, very mixed emotions right now so I'm going to go get lost in a good paperback book.  Fiction of course because reality is more than I want to think about right now.  Physically I'm feeling great, emotionally not so good.  Next tx friday and I can't wait.  One more under my belt.  Love and prayers to everyone, Cindy
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 21, 2008 08:31PM cinlee wrote: Hugs and luv to you tomorrow Angie.  You'll do fine.  We're here for you and actually I was very surprised how uneventful the 1st tx was. Prayers to you Cindy
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 22, 2008 03:08AM cinlee wrote: Welcome Kristiy Ann, you've come to a great place for support. Thanks otter for the list, I've been trying to keep everyone's schedule straight but it was getting confusing. Angie you'll do fine tomorrow, can't wait to hear back from you after your tx. Hugs and prayers to Wildrose and revkat tomorrow too. Love Cindy
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 25, 2008 05:08PM cinlee wrote: Hi everyone, just got home from tx#2.  Went very well.  Picked my granddaughter up and went to dinner at my Uncles Restaurant had a great pan seared tilapia dish served on a bed of greens and beans then came home.  Feeling a little groggy now.  Surprised because 1st tx steroids kept me up for 2 days.  They didn't give me any in my pre chemo bag this time though, just pill form last night and this morning.  Angie sorry to here you're having such a bad time.  My 1st tx I was constipated for 5 days, I finally took some Senna+ which the pharmacist said was the best and on day 6 I ended up on the toilet for 20mins.  It's been free flowing since.  ER doc prescribed Mirilax after I finished antibiotic he put me on but I haven't needed it yet.  He also said to wait 2hrs after I take my Zantac and Prilosec to take the Mirilax or it wouldn't work.  Hang in there it will get better and before you know it you'll be spending lots of time in the bathroom. Happy Birthday today jas and Happy Birthday weekend NancyD. Otter glad to hear you're feeling good.  You and I are on the same tx of T/C. but you're 2 days ahead of me.  I think I'm pretty prepared this time. KristyAnn glad to hear you're day went ok except for the long day. Thai and RNKaren hope everything went well for you today. Kalyla thinking about you....hope you're doing ok. hugs and prayers to everyone. rest up and enjoy the weekend. Cindy
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 13, 2008 01:44PM - edited Apr 13, 2008 01:46PM by cinlee Hi everyone, I'm back, sorry I haven't kept in touch.  The last few days have been pretty bad.  I was extremely depressed because of not having a significant other to help me get through this.  I met someone on line the week I was diagnosed and he was so helpful and supportive as he lost his wife to lung cancer 3 yrs ago and he survived bladder cancer himself.  We met and went out for a bite to eat a few times.  The night before my treatment he had me over just to comfort me and calm my jitters about my first treatment...yup one thing led to another and I gave in....the day after my treatment he e-mailed me to say he couldn't see me anymore because it was causing him to remember his wife's suffering and he couldn't go through it again even through I wouldn't be going through nearly as much suffering as she did and that it really was just sex the other night and yadayadayada.....he said that I will learn that I have to be selfish sometimes to survive and that I could call him a jerk or an idiot....needless to say I called him a hell of a lot more than that and told him I could never be so cold and selfish as him...then I beat myself up for giving in to someone so quickly without getting to know him better...anyway's I'm over that.  Back to tx s/e.  I worked all week, only had constipation.  Took senna+ as druggist prescribed, then all of a sudden on day 5 felt sick so I came home early from work and did get sick, felt ok Thursday so I went to work and got through my 10hr. day but felt crappy so I told the doc, (work for a chiropractor for those who don't know me) I was going to take Friday off.  We're only open for a half day anyway's and he had no problem with that.  OMG on my way home I didn't know if I was going to get sick or explode from the other end.  Got real panicky and wasn't sure I'd get home in time.  Had severe sharp pains in stomach like I did years ago when I had an ulcer and heavy chest like GERD symptoms.  Called the chemo doc he said call my PCP as it sounds like gastro problems I already have are worse because of chemo and to take Maalox.  My aunt brought home Maalox and I took it and 10mins. later thought I was dieing.  Sitting on the toilet with bucket in hand and didn't stop for 20 minutes.  Went to my PCP on Friday and he upped my prilosec to 2x's a day and said get Zantax to add to that.  Yesterday wasn't too bad just diarrhea rather than constipation and tired.  Watched my little old lady with Alzheimer's yesterday she always cheers me up.
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 13, 2008 07:12AM cinlee wrote: Thanks Nancy, Love the hair.  That's my next obstacle.  I have already ordered 2 wigs and 2 really cute scarves from Paula Young on 4/8.  It said 7-10 days delivery I hope I didn't wait too long.  My tx's got moved up a week earlier than originally planned so now I'm freaking out that they won't arrive in time.  I took my grand daughter to a wig shop with my friday to try on wigs and try to make a fun day of it by being silly and including her in it and trying on all kinds of different styles but the woman at the store was going to have no part of that.  She was all business and not at all compassionate.  The wigs I did try on were in the $400.00 range and looked so fake and wig like that I was so depressed when I left there.  Now I'm scared to death that the one's I ordered on line are going to look terrible as they costs only a fraction of that.  I'm thinking about calling my hairdresser today and see if she'll cut my hair in a short cut today.  They've been absolutely wonderful and told me whenever I'm ready even if she's not open she'll do whatever I need whenever I'm ready.  I don't think I'll ever be ready but it has to be done and I think going real short before the actual shave is better.  I don't know I'll see.
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 14, 2008 07:14PM cinlee wrote: Thanks girls for all the support....as far as the jerk goes I'm over that...he's the loser not me. Great Do Ellenoire....wish I had you're courage....the worst part about the timing being off with that guy was the it was really really good....lol....definitely took my mind off what I was going to have to do the next day. Susan how did you're first tx go today? Got a sore throat today and my ears were bothering me over the weekend...don't know if it's cold symptoms or the chemo but feel like crap again today....only worked half day today....everyday I run my hands through my hair to see if it's falling out yet...I'm on day 11...wigs may not be here til around the 21st....I'm going to the onc doc for my 10 day check on Wed. Everyone take care...you're all in my thoughts and prayers and thank you again so much for the support...it means everything to me to be able to talk to someone who understands....my family doesn't really like to talk about it....they ask how I'm doing but when I try to explain they don't really want to hear it or just change the subject.
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 18, 2008 07:00AM cinlee wrote: bcs75, I am 14 days out from 1st tx and I've been doing the same thing for the last 3 or 4 days, running my hands through my hair.  Like you I'm almost wishing it would just start so I can deal with it and get on with other things.  My onc said it would start falling out week 3.  It doesn't seem to be doing anything yet although I have noticed my eyebrows are thinning already. kalyla glad to hear you're doing better. I'm at work after being out since Tues.  Feels good to be back and feeling human again.
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 21, 2008 08:35PM - edited Apr 21, 2008 08:35PM by cinlee btw...my first day at work with my wig and the patients are commenting on my new hairstyle and how cute it is.  Most of them don't even realize it's a wig...and this one only costs me $44 form Paula Young catalog.  My neck and shoulder's are stiff because I'm afraid to move my head because I'm worried it's going to move or something but it hasn't and I have the added advantage that I work for a chiroprator so he just gave me an adjustment and told me to, "loosen up it looks great and it's not going to go anywhere"....
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 24, 2008 02:38AM cinlee wrote: Hi girls, Lauren I was thinking of doing the same thing....the no no with the razor.  I shaved my head on Sunday and have found wearing the scarves much more comfortable than wearing the wig but by the end of the day even with the scarves I can't wait to take them off and give my head a breather. RNKaren, I have been slowly losing my eyebrows and started wearing fake eyelashes when I shaved my head.  I have very large eyes and very thin eyelashes so I want to accentuate the positive as they say and draw peoples eyes away from the wig. I'm tired tonight, between my 2 jobs I've put in 33hrs. in 3 days and got another 10hr. day tomorrow then only half day friday, but I need to get the hours in while I'm feeling good.  Tx #2 at 1pm right after work on friday. Hope everyone is doing well today that had treatments this week. Good luck to those of you tomorrow. Everyone's in my thoughts and prayers as always. Lots of hugs, Cindy
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 24, 2008 02:48AM cinlee wrote: Speaking of driving.....I was planning on driving myself to my tx friday.  My son took me the first time because we weren't sure what to expect and I was fine afterwards.  For those who have had you're second tx any reason I shouldn't drive myself Friday.  I do decadron the night before and morning of, then again in my iv then t/c.  Last time I was so wired from the decadron I could have driven for hours....lol.  I'm assuming I should be ok to drive? Cindy
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Mar 31, 2008 04:03AM - edited Mar 31, 2008 04:06AM by cinlee Hi I'm guessing that I'll be starting chemo in April.  I had a lumpectomy on 3/10.  Pathology reports a little confusing...one line says invasive ductal carcinoma, grade I, 1.7cm and another line says DCIS, nuclear grade 2, ER+/PR+ (understand that part) HER2/neu overexpression: borderline (2+)....because of that the chemo onc is sending tissue out for more tests...I was fortunate that the lymph nodes tested negative...tomorrow I go for a bone scan and also to meet my radiation onc.  Tues. to dentist for check up which I read should be done before chemo.  Wed. back to surgeon for second post op visit then next week to primary for pap as last one 6 months ago came back positive then back to chemo onc on 4/9 for results of HER2/neu tests.  He has already suggested chemo every 3 wks. for 4 session if negative or 6 sessions if positive along with Hercepton once a week for first 18 weeks then every 3 wks for balance of a yr....radiation is a given with the lumpectomy and I'm assuming that won't start until after the chemo is done?  I work for a chiropractor in a small office...my primary responsibility is billing and receivables but I also cover for the only other employee there and she covers for me when one of us is out....I'm very concerned about lost time from work and how difficult this has already been financially and it's only just begun....I've been able to keep a pretty good attitude about the whole hair loss think but am real concerned about the fatigue and inability to work.  It's great to have support and be able to talk to woman who are going through the same thing.  Any and all input or advise is welcome.
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 1, 2008 01:47AM cinlee wrote: Hi everyone...went for bone scan that was a breeze...met my radiation oncologist....she was great also....feeling pretty good today...as I mentioned I work for a chiropractor and I find myself wanting to tell all the patients, partly because most of the time talking about it keeps me going because people are so good about supporting me and telling me I'm going to do fine but I realized it's also because I want to warn them before they come in and see me with either a wig on or wearing scarves....because I'm more worried about it freaking them out and then having them ignore me and avoid me or putting them in an uncomfortable position.....does that make sense?  Also want to add...woman are fighters and are strong and we're all going to get through this...having this site is a great help for me....thank you to everyone.
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 2, 2008 09:12AM cinlee wrote: Glad to hear it Otter good luck Sue and Sheri...I'll be thinking of you and you're all in my prayers. got good news today...my bone scan came back with no problems...because I work for a chiropractor I was able to have the results faxed here to him rather than wait until my next appt with onc.on 4/9
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 2, 2008 07:34PM cinlee wrote: Hi everyone, Well I'm officially an April baby...my test results came back early so I called my chemo onc today and he said there's no sense in waiting til next Wednesday...my bone scan was negative and my HER2 was also negative....hooray for that so I will only be doing 4 sessions every 3 weeks of Taxol and Cytoxan and I start Friday 4/4....all week I've been saying I just want to get this thing started and now it's like "wait" I'm not ready yet...it hit me tonight on the way home from work this is really going to happen and I'm scared...oh yea I checked today and my Insurance doesn't cover a wig...my son will be going with me even though I told him he didn't have to sit there with me that long he insists...my daughter unfortunately is a newly recovering addict so it's best at this time that she's not there....I hope this opens her eyes and will help her continue to get the help she's getting and stays clean....because of that I'm already on Zanax for anxiety and that helps me sleep so I'm going to try and get some....good luck to everyone and I'll be thinking of all of you Friday....{{{Big Hug}}}...I know I could use one right now so I'm sure you can too....really, really wish I had a significant other right now:( Sorry no more negative stuff...goodnight talk to you all soon.
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 4, 2008 02:21AM cinlee wrote: Hi everyone, Picked up my scripts during lunch today and got them filled gotta take 5 little pills tonight and my usual Zanax and then 5 more in the morning.  Only work til 12:30 on Fridays but it's been hell trying to stay focused on my work so of course that's getting piled up on my desk and stressing me out.  My first tx is tomorrow at 1.  My son is going to go with me.  I called my 8 year old granddaughter today to tell her I couldn't pick her up at school tomorrow like usual and the first thing she said was "grandma did you lose your hair yet?"  She thinks it's funny that I'm going to be bald.  We're planning a dress up day to go to the wig shop and be silly and try on funny wigs.  I'm trying to make this as unscary for her as possible.  She's the love of my life and the one that keeps me going and she told me not to worry cause if I get sick she can take care of me.  I'm actually anxious to get this first one done and behind me.  From the sounds of it tomorrow will be fine it's the days to follow that scare me a little.  I'll definitely being thinking of you all tomorrow.  I've been getting a lot of positive support from all the patients that come into the office which has been nice and one of them is a hairdresser and she told me about a catalog with Paula Young wigs that are inexpensive and nice wigs.  She said the key is to look for the ones that say lightweight filament...I think that's what she said....damn I've had chemo brain all week and haven't even started yet...lol.  Anyway's everyone take care love you all and talk to you tomorrow.  Sleep well. Cindy
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 16, 2008 08:26PM cinlee wrote: Hi Otter, I wasn't sure about the color of my wigs either but I got lucky and they match my hair very well.  As I said before the wig that is styled exactly like mine is much fuller than my hair so I have to have it trimmed a little. I got virus over the last couple of days and spent the evening in emergency...also having blood in my stools.  No blood in my stomach so now they want stool samples, (not sure why they didn't do that at the hospital last night), went for my 10 day checkup today with chemo onc.  He feels that it is virus related and not  from chemo becomes blood counts are not bad.  That's a relief but still concerned what's causing the black stools.  Sore throat really making it difficult to sleep and needless to say I'm exhausted.  Otter I'm a day behind you and I'm constantly checking to see if my hair is falling out yet.  No signs yet.  Good luck with the color choice.  Thinking of everyone.  God bless and good night.
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 18, 2008 07:21AM cinlee wrote: Glad to hear you're feeling better Lauren.  My grand daughter who is 8 told everyone in group at school that I was going to be bald too.  She can't wait to see how funny I'm going to look but she doesn't want strangers to see me bald.  Kids are the best medicine for any ailment!!!!!!
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 18, 2008 01:15PM cinlee wrote: Oh and a HUGE THANK YOU to all of you who have been supportive and sharing with me.  I can't tell you how much this site means to me.  It's so nice to have people understand what you're feeling because they are going through the same thing and it's hard for family and friends who aren't to understand sometimes.  Love again, Cindy
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 18, 2008 02:52PM cinlee wrote: Sue because my 1st chemo treatment was at the beginning of April I went to the March chemo women and read all of their experiences with s/e and suggestions and that helped me a lot when it came time to chemo shop and you'll find as you go along which things work for you specifically and which don't and what will taste good and what won't.  Probably one of the most important things is drink, drink, drink and drink somemore even if you think you can't....(and I'm not talking wine...lol).  I went to my dentist for a checkup before my chemo started and he suggested Biotene mouthwash and toothpaste to prevent mouth sores.  It's very mild and I've had no problems with mouth sores.  My chemo nurse also emphasized alcohol free mouthwash....I bought a lot of Gatorade but don't like it so I pretty much just drink water.
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 23, 2008 01:31AM cinlee wrote: congratulations Angie you did it....remember drink drink drink revkat and Wildrose hope you're feeling ok after you're tx's today too. good luck tomorrow to tomatojuice, bcs75, beachmom13, Kfalls, ellenoire, and otter, (without whom I couldn't have remembered everyone, thanks again for keeping track of everyone so closely, you're a great inspiration) swimangel 72 is your PS going to allow you to do you're tx tomorrow?  If so good luck. Love and prayers and hugs to everyone Cindy btw....it feels great to feel good for a few days.  Wore a scarf to work today and it was much more comfortable than the wig.
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 24, 2008 04:49AM - edited Apr 24, 2008 04:52AM by cinlee Lee and Lauren I have a 5 minute drive from work to cancer center and then 10-15 mins. home depending on traffic.  I live in Upstate NY so it's funny to hear someone say commuter rail and subway...I've never been to NYC but someday I'll get there.  If I don't feel like I can drive my son is 5 mins. away so I'll call him and my daughter-in-law will bring him over and get me and my car and take me home. Lee when I get really bad headaches, usually behind my eyes and at the nape of my neck, I lay down in a dark room and alternate an icepack back and forth from my eyes to the nape of my neck about 20 mins. on each.  I don't remember where I got the idea from but one day I tried it and I've been doing it for years and it works.  I'm thinking it numbs everything so the tension goes away.  Give it a try and let me know if it helps. Cindy

Love, hugs and prayers to everyone. Cindy

Posts.Content: Apr 2, 2008 09:24AM cinlee wrote: Sorry Evie....didn't mean to leave you out...still getting used to how this site works...thinking about you also and saying a prayer for you also....trying to sneak these in at work without getting caught...can't concentrate on work...don't want to be here today...would much rather be taking a brisk walk on the beach...cool out but the sun is shining and there are some crocus' popping up....gotta go girls..ttyl
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 2, 2008 09:04PM cinlee wrote: Hi Angie, I know how you feel, but remember if this is what we have to do to stay alive, then so let it be, God will help us become survivors...I think I heard that somewhere just recently...lol.  In my eyes you are already a survivor after all you've been through.  I read some of these stories and then think to myself, what am I complaining about, these other woman have been through a lot more than I have and they're still here cheering each other on.  Yes it's scary and yes it's changed our lives but I'm sure we've all been through some type of trauma in our lives that was difficult and we all managed to get through it one way or another and this is no different.  Hang on and take one day at a time.  Maybe you should look for some positive threads from woman who have gotten past chemo and are doing well and read those to give you some hope that it will be ok, one way or another you will be ok.  We'll get through this together.  My prayers are with you and with everyone else. Cindy
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 4, 2008 04:21PM cinlee wrote: That's funny Sandra, Thanks for sharing that.  Kids are great and so innocent and honest and carefree.  It's the adults that I'm having a lot of resistance from about shaving my head.  Especially my grandmother she keeps saying just wait and see you never know it might not fall out...I've reassured her that the doctor said it will start at week 3 and I will definitly lose all of it.  I've already picked out 4 wigs from Paula Youngs...now I have to narrow it down to 1 or 2 because of cost...my insurance doesn't cover them...thanks again for sharing your story it's great to have people who get it to talk to...good luck and keep in touch...i'm off for my first chemo cocktail...til later...God speed and keep smiling everyone. Cindy
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 5, 2008 09:57AM cinlee wrote: Hi Otter, I'm happy everything went well for you, hope you're still doing good.  I'm a day behind you.  I had my first on 4/4 and like you it was pretty uneventful, my son went with me and my daughter stopped by so the 4 hrs. went by quickly and I'm fortunate that I only have a 5min. drive from work to the center and then 20 mins. home from there.  Got done about 4pm and went to dinner with some family members, nurse told me to eat anything I wanted to if it tastes good.  Didn't eat a lot but everything tasted ok so far.  Got home about 7:30 and thought I wanted to crash especially since I had been up since 4:30am but layed down and did nothing but toss and turn, got up at 10:30 had some water and popsicle and went back to bed and watched the clock all night so here I am up at 4:30am again and haven't hardly slept at all...so far no other side affects....except I can tell I'm going to have problems with constipation.  It's good to know I've got 1 down only 3 more to go but it's like I'm waiting for the other shoe to drop wondering if there are going to be more s/e.  Been looking at wigs and scarves and hats and things but gotta start making some serious plans to make a decision about when to deal with that whole issue.  I hope everyone is doing well. Cindy
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 7, 2008 10:10AM cinlee wrote: Thought coming to work would be a good idea but not so sure now, not feeling too bad physically but emotionally a wreck.  I hate this I don't want to go through this alone.
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 13, 2008 11:27AM cinlee wrote: Thanks Otter, I'll check it out cause god knows I could use some laughs right now and I don't want to be negative on this one all the time which is why I haven't written in a few days.  You're a day ahead of me so I look forward to hearing you're input.  I would really rather be more supportive than a winer so I'll continue on here when I'm feeling up and go to no positive thinking when I'm having a bad day.....Just went shopping for my new diet regimen and am exhausted...gonna take a nap.  Cindy
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 18, 2008 02:01PM cinlee wrote: Hi Sue, First of all don't every apologize for whining.  You're not alone, I know I've done it more than once.  After all that's part of what this whole site is about.  Supporting each other on good days and bad days and if you don't let us know you're having a bad day we can't be there for you.  I think everyone else will agree with me.  Although we don't know each other personally we're all in this together.  Hang in there honey.  You'll find you'll be able to talk to all of us about things you don't feel comfortable talking to family and friends about and that we understand so don't hesitate to ask questions and whine when you need to.  When you're having a good day you'll find yourself encouraging someone who's having a bad one.  And you will have good days too.{{{{{{{{{HUG}}}}}}}}  Cindy
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 24, 2008 05:09AM cinlee wrote: sueper13, lewing and tiff2008 good luck with tx #1 Tigwin and SQK with tx#2 and Lauren with tx #3. You'll all be in my thoughts and prayers today, hang in there and we'll get through this together.  We've got a great support system here.  I want to thank everyone for their support too because my Gram and my Aunt don't like to talk about it so it's nice to come home after a long day at work and have friends to talk to and hear from that are sharing the same experience.  Although yesterday when I got ready to leave for work I asked my gram if I looked ok and she said, "honey you always look nice", that meant more to me than she will ever know.  Everytime I thought about it yesterday it warmed my heart.  I know they love me and care very much but I'm the first one in our family and we have a very large family, 5 generations in fact, that has had to go through this so this is all new to them too. well better get moving or I'm going to be late to work.  At least I don't have to worry about washing my hair and blow drying and styling, just throw my scarf on and go.  Sometimes this hair loss thing isn't so bad...lol.  Love you all and hope it's a good day for everyone. Hugs and prayers, Cindy
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 5, 2008 01:38PM cinlee wrote: I'm having a difficult time.  Haven't slept at all.  My face and neck and upper chest are all red and flushed but no fever.  Exhausted but can't sleep.  I went shopping and stocked up on fluids and pudding and oatmeal and such thought that might tire me out enough to sleep but hasn't work yet.  Trying to stay positive and keeping up the fight. Cindy
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 18, 2008 05:05AM cinlee wrote: Good morning girls, Feeling better so I'm going to push myself to go to work....not only have I been out all week and gotten lazy, the weather is suppose to be in the 70's again today and being from Upstate NY that's a luxury right now....  Lauren sorry to hear that you're not feeling well, my doctor has me on both Prilosec and Zantac, they pumped my stomach in the hospital but there was no blood then they also gave me an IV of something that blocks the acids in the stomach so I'm feeling much better but chemo onc said it was because of my previous history of gastro problems that it got so bad and sore throat was viral and not from chemo.  I also feel for you, although my kids are grown now, I remember very well what it's like to raise a child alone especially when you feel crappy.  I also remember how good the unconditional love they have for you feels and how great they're hugs are.  When I was feeling so crappy the other night, all I wanted was a hug from my daughter and granddaughter so that's where I went and it helped a lot.  Hang in there and know that I'm thinking of you and everyone else. Cindy
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 23, 2008 11:31AM - edited Apr 23, 2008 11:31AM by cinlee Good morning leesa, sorry to hear you have to go through this whole thing again, but you made it through once and you can do it again.  If you've read back you'll see that this is a very caring and supportive and with otter a very knowledgeable group.  We'll help you through. Tomatojuice sorry to hear you had such a difficult time with the port, I will be thinking of you today along with everyone else. Anyone heard from swimangel72 whether she's going to be able to get her tx today? As alway's I'll be thinking of everyone and saying a prayer for all of us.  I go Friday 4/25 and can't wait to get another one done and over with.  I think I'm more prepared for the s/e this time. Cindy
